required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimization of Quality in Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Through Monitor-defibrillator With Feedback System
clinical_study.official_title: Optimization of Quality in Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Through Monitor-defibrillator With Feedback System

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

brief_summary.textblock:
AIM: To verify the effect of a feedback system on optimizing quality during CPR on mannequins.
Hypothesis: The quality of CPR performed by healthcare professionals through a defibrillator monitor with a feedback system is higher than those that do not use a feedback system on a manikin.
METHOD Type of study: Pre-experimental with pretest-postest design. Sample: Health professionals of the General Emergency Service of the Virgen de la Arrixaca University Hospital (HCUVA).
Sampling type: Non-probabilistic for convenience. Variables: sex, age, profession, years of experience, last CPR training received, last time performing CPR, depth, frequency, quality CPR, perception of the quality of CPR.
Statistical analysis: Student's t for related samples and McNemar.

primary_outcome.description: Depth of chest compressions performed by the subject
Frequency of the number of chest compressions per minute performed by the subject
Total quality of the cardiopulmonary resuscitation performed by the subject

arm_group.description: Once the sample was selected, a test was performed in which the professionals performed 2 minutes of CPR on the dummy without any feedback system, after 5 minutes they performed 2 minutes of CPR with feedback system through the Zoll® monitor with CPR patch -D padz training, to later compare the pretest-posttest results.

intervention.description: Once the sample was selected, a test was performed in which the professionals performed 2 minutes of CPR on the dummy without any feedback system, after 5 minutes they performed 2 minutes of CPR with feedback system through the Zoll® monitor with CPR patch -D padz training, to later compare the pretest-posttest results.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects belonging to the General Emergency Department of the Hospital Clinico Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca corresponding with doctors, resident doctors and nurses who are working in the service during the study period and receive the training session on CPR quality and the use of the defibrillator monitor with feedback system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Health professionals working in the General Emergency Service of the Virgen de la Arrixaca University Clinical Hospital during the study period. They include doctors, resident doctors, and nurses.
- Health professionals from the General Emergency Service of the Virgen de la Arrixaca University Hospital who receive the training session on CPR quality and use of the defibrillator monitor with feedback system.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Health professionals who do not work in the General Emergency Service of the Virgen de la Arrixaca University Clinical Hospital during the study period.
- Health professionals who work in the General Emergency Service of the Virgen de la Arrixaca University Hospital and refuse to carry out the training and demonstration session.

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital Clínico Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca
